00045 template <class T> 
00046 std::string ToStr(const T &t) {
00047   std::ostringstream s;
00048   s.setf(std::ios_base::boolalpha);
00049   s << t;
00050   
00051   if(s.str() == "-1.#INF")
00052       return(ToStr("-inf"));
00053   else if(s.str() == "1.#INF")
00054       return(ToStr("inf"));
00055   else if(s.str() == "-1.#IND")
00056       return(ToStr("nan"));
00057   else if(s.str() == "1.#IND")
00058       return(ToStr("nan"));
00059   else if(s.str() == "-Inf")
00060       return(ToStr("-inf"));
00061   else if(s.str() == "Inf")
00062       return(ToStr("inf"));
00063 
00064   return s.str();
00065 };
00066 
00067 // /// @brief     Convert the arg to a string.
00068 // /// @param     arg     which is a string already.
00069 // /// @return    a string
00070 // /// @remark    Since it is a string already, no conversion needs to be done.
00071 // ///            ToStr returns a new string, so we match that.
00072 // template <> 
00073 // std::string ToStr(const std::string& str) {
00074 //   std::string newstr=str;
00075 //   return newstr;
00076 // };
